articles.content:
Homage paid to Kim Il Sung
     Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Senior officials of the party and state, anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters, former unconverted long-term prisoners who are pro-reunification patriotic fighters, people from all walks of life, servicepersons and the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the national democratic front of South Korea visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung on July 8 on the occasion of the eighth anniversary of his demise.
 A floral basket was placed before his statue in the joint name of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, the Central Military Commission of the WPK, the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and the cabinet of the DPRK.    
 Meanwhile, the diplomatic corps and the military attaches' corps here and overseas Koreans visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace to pay homage to the president.
